Pawan Negi Research Scholar
Publications Courses CV Contact

The source code of all the publications are available at https://gitlab.com/pypr in the interest of reproducibility.

Publications

  • Pawan Negi and Prabhu Ramachandran, "How to train your solver: A method of manufactured solutions for weakly-compressible SPH", under review. https://arxiv.org/abs/2109.09697

  • Pawan Negi and Prabhu Ramachandran, "A new family of second order convergent weakly-compressible SPH schemes", under review. https://arxiv.org/abs/2107.11859

  • Prabhu Ramachandran, Aditya Bhosale, Kunal Puri, Pawan Negi, Abhinav Muta, A Dinesh, Dileep Menon, Rahul Govind, Suraj Sanka, Amal S Sebastian, Ananyo Sen, Rohan Kaushik, Anshuman Kumar, Vikas Kurapati, Mrinalgouda Patil, Deep Tavker, Pankaj Pandey, Chandrashekhar Kaushik, Arkopal Dutt, Arpit Agarwal, "PySPH: a Python-based framework for smoothed particle hydrodynamics", ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software, volume 47, number 4, article 34, July 2021 doi:10.1145/3460773 https://arxiv.org/abs/1909.04504

  • Pawan Negi, and Prabhu Ramachandran. “Algorithms for Uniform Particle Initialization in Domains with Complex Boundaries.” Computer Physics Communications 265 (August 1, 2021): 108008. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cpc.2021.108008

  • Abhinav Muta, Prabhu Ramachandran, and Pawan Negi. “An Efficient, Open Source, Iterative ISPH Scheme.” Computer Physics Communications 255 (October 1, 2020): 107283. ttps://doi.org/10.1016/j.cpc.2020.107283

  • Pawan Negi, Prabhu Ramachandran, and Asmelash Haftu. “An Improved Non-Reflecting Outlet Boundary Condition for Weakly-Compressible SPH.” Computer Methods in Applied Mechanics and Engineering 367 (August 1, 2020): 113119. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cma.2020.113119
